caption: Me and my wife went to celebrate our anniversary and the waiter was incompetent. We both ordered the salmon which was fine. But we asked him about what came with it and he said it was ALL ala carte.  Well we proceeded to order two sides each and that was ridiculous as our table was packed with food. He had us order all of that food unnecessarily. So we didn’t complain there as my wife didn’t want to spoil the evening. But I just can’t let it go. Now, it’s not the money but he should know the menu or ask someone before having people spend on things they don’t need.  I have been to Morton’s on other occasions and NEVER had an issue but he just ....... My wife doesn’t want me to put his name here which I feel I should but. I just want people in the future to ask about what comes with their meal.  Since our visit I have spoken to the manager and he apologized for the waiter and he has since rectified the situation. I definitely highly recommend this location for your dining pleasure.

Decided to take myself on a solo date here as a form of self care (LOL). It’s needed. And I truly enjoyed my food. From the appetizers, to the entree. The meal was wonderful. My favorite was the chocolate mousse. It was very delicious! I wished it came in a bigger size. I’m taking a star off because although my food was great the waiter was not bringing it or attending to me in a timely fashion.
Great steak

It was my first time dining at Morton's Steakhouse and it will not be my last. From the Host to the Wait staff to the atmosphere, everything was 5 star. Marchaun was our waiter and he was absolutely amazing. He explained what certain food items were and made excellent suggestions based off of what we like and are used to. All the food I ate was magnificent. Kudos to the chef. I have already made my plan to come back. Morton's Steakhouse really gives you an experience. One that you won't forget. Thank you so very much. I wish I could give you 10 stars.

I will start out by saying that we wanted to make a reservation at Ruth's Chris, The Prime Rib, or Capital Grill all of which we have been to before and have had great meals. There were no tables available at any of these between 6 - 8pm but there were plenty at Morton's so we decided to give it a try. Now I know why.. The food was fair at best, but nothing great. We ordered the Grand Seafood tower and the lobster that came with it looked  more like a crawfish tail, It was tiny. The Shrimp were tasteless. The sides selection was OK and the steaks were blah. Our server made a mistake and put in the wrong steak for my wife (it happens) so when the steaks came out he had to take hers back and leave my daughter and I to start eating so ours would not get cold while my wife waited for her correct meal. Again, it happens. The worst part was after the steak finally arrives, a manager came over to apologize an ask how everything was. How do you think it was?  He should have at least offered my wife a free drink, a desert or something, but he did not. Terrible customers service on his part. We will not be returning.

Lovely. We did take out. The website was very easy to navigate - very good selection of steaks and done-ness. After ordering, I realized I made a mistake and neglected to request the steak be bagged separately from the rest of the hot food. I called up to make this request and the gentleman I spoke to was professional, friendly and accommodating. When I arrived to pick up our food, everything was ready for me, exactly on time. The steak was bagged separately (as requested) and our desserts were also separate, so they wouldn’t melt on the way home. I really appreciated this thoughtfulness. We put our hot food in the warming drawer when I arrived home so we could start our evening with a martini. When we opened our entrees and sides to eat, we were extremely impressed. My husband had his 16oz Centre cut Rib eye rare and it was perfectly cooked. He raved about it. He said the cognac sauce au poivre was tasty and he was so happy he ordered it. The side dishes we ordered were decadent - sour cream mashed potatoes, The Troy and grilled asparagus. All lovely (and truthfully we had some left over to finish the next day, it was a lot of food). I had the Miso Marinated Sea Bass and it was wonderful. Opening the to-go container, the air was filled with a delicious, fragrant smell. The sea bass was perfectly cooked - moist, mouthwatering - a perfect texture. The broth and bok choi it was served with were both lovely. We didn’t have room for dessert, so ate our desserts the next day. Delicious. My husband loved his New York Style cheesecake and my key lime pie was perfect - tart and beautifully textured. Next time, we will order appetizers.
Wonderful, polite and efficient service and delicious food.  10/10 would go again.
What an Amazing Valentine's Dinner! Team Morton's of Baltimore always delivers...#LetsGoLetsMove
I would have gave a 5 star but the burnt parts was throwing it off. Everything else about it was👌🏾👌🏾
Outstanding
Amazing a bit pricey but the lobster macaroni and cheese was out of this world service was a little slow but the bartender had four hats on that night
Delicious food, excellent service. Romantic atmosphere!

Usually I eat in doors when I go there, and I have always received excellent service in the multiple locations I have visited in multiple states. Due to the pandemic I was able to get take out; the cajun steak is my favorite, and it did not fail my expectations last night.
A bit pricey but food was good

Excellent steak..skip the seafood...just fair.  Not terrible...The ribeye  was the best steak we ever had...the lobster mac and cheese full of lobster worth the price. The lobster  sweet but tiny.  Like 4 bites  for 50 $ . The place is intimate  cozy..clean.  Great management. Our server ; Demetrius  so on point  and pleasant.   So good we tipped 35 % .only real complaint  is it was really  cold in the restaurant. But management promptly  turned the heat up when asked.. The chef is  obviously  very talented.  I RECOMMEND  FOR THE BEST  GO TO  FOR  STEAK...HANDS DOWN!
great
We always get treated well here, and we enjoy the food. This was not our best visit, but the food was pretty good. Crazy corona times. Can't wait to get back to normal.
I constantly arrive buying some food in this spot. I enjoyed the fast service and well prepared dishes. 5 stars.
Loved the food and the service was Great....
Nice place
Do yourself a favor and give this place a try. The service here is attentive. It has a good feel to it.

The service was terrible I went to a dinner party there and the service was awful. My food came out after waiting for 2 hours and it was cold. The bread was disgusting. Nets fell inside my drink and the waiter just took it after I told them never apologized or anything. The food was COLD AND DISGUSTING!!! Never again will I go to this place needs to shut it down.
The meals and service were ahead of our expectations. I absolutely liked the atmosphere of this spot. First-rate spot to take my family out for dinner.
Ribeye steak was really juicy & flavorful. Sides were good but could have been served a little hotter. Waiter was great.
Their food tastes so gooood
Thus was a very clean delicious food and nice people
I had a wonderful time. I got all my monies worth..I can't wait to visit again.
Excellent meal as usual & amazing hospitality from Patrick the manager
Cajun ribeye was delicious.
Great food great help i highly recommend
Horrible. I forgot why I hadn't been but tonight reminded me.

It was a stunning experience. I ordered the filet mignon, which was seasoned to perfection and done simply. The miso Chilean bass was exceptional though, the flavor was like nothing I had ever had before. After trying the fish, the steak just did not compare. The staff was excellent, they were friendly, professional, patient, as well as accommodating as they possibly could be. The mashed potatoes seemed like they had been combined with instant potatoes and were a bit on the salty/runny side.
looking forward to coming back with my friends. they have a lot of great reviews for a reason.
This place is absolutely outstanding. I'll return with my friends. Prices were fair for the quality of the food.

The Entire Staff Is Excellent. Management came over and spoke since it's been a while since he seen me. The bartender was very helpful. Malcolm helped me pick out a meal on the menu because I am Pescatarian. The salmon that I ordered wasn't cooked all the way threw so I had to send it back. I will be visiting again this week.
Very very very very very nice place
This place is amazing...a masterpiece!!
The meal was delicious the service was superb can't wait to go back service was excellent
Always a great experience!
Great!!!!

Came here Friday night for a friend’s birthday dinner. Food was okay and service was good. My only problem is that they only allow 6 people at a table because of COVID and we had 7 people. But, there’s a private dining area where someone else was having a dinner with about more than 10 people at a table so I guess if you want to have a dinner here with more than 6 people you should inquire about the private dining area.
Amazing service!
Good food. Ok service. Ok atmosphere. And this from black man 86.
Limited menu but great as always.
Good food as always and good social distancing procedures
Nice Atmosphere. Waitress was very accommodating. Steak was not cooked to ordered it was sent back and was still not cooked to order when it came back out.

I went to Morton's last night to help my Sister and Brother in Law celebrate their Wedding Anniversary.  The staff at Morton's was Not Only Accomodating and Friendly but they went above and beyond to make the evening Special for their Anniversary.  The received special dessert for the Occassion and the table was present with Specially Personalized Anniversary Menus.  It was An Amazing Evening.  Staff 5 stars, Food 5 Stars, Service 5 stars.  Thanks Mortons Staff for a Beautiful couples Night Out!! And I saw other reviews that said the prices were cheap.  THERE IS NOTHING CHEAP ABOUT THIS PLACE!!  And WORTH Every Penny❤🥂
Service is prompt even when they are busy. The staff was very friendly and kind.
Really convenient location, the food is very good, the prices are cheap and the staff is helpful and kind!
My waitress was awesome the best6
Best steakhouse hands down!!!!!

I made the reservations ahead of time like a week before. And everything was on point. Our waiter, Brandon was awesome. He was very patient and attentive to us. Follow all the COVID-19 procedures. Made my girlfriend’s birthday very special with the photo and the dessert. The food was awesome. Perfection. Nothing wrong. Overall, 100/100 I am very satisfied with everything. Thank you Morton’s Steakhouse
Staff is exceptional like the food!  It is located in the Sheraton hotel.

We went for my girlfriend's birthday. The staff was amazing. We each had our favorite steaks, a side and a bottle of wine. I had the filet. It was a perfect medium rare steak with truffle butter. My side was button mushrooms with spinach. The natural flavors of the mushrooms and spinachsspinach through. My server recommended the perfect pairing wine with my order. The perfect night. I can't wait to go back.

This place is certainly one of the finest place to eat in the area. Every time I go there I am deeply glad. They preserve their very high  level service and the highest level of meals  they provide. You definitely will enjoy this this restaurant. Very  recommended.
Pretty good steak!

last night was our first time we visited this good restaurant. But It is definitely not the last time. We enjoyed the evening very much with the good service, with the magnificent cooking and booze and with the decent charge. We will surely come back soon.
Nasty & hi

My wife typically likes Morton's.  We made a reservation to celebrate our Anniversary.  The waiter was not impressive at all.  Neither of our steaks were prepared as ordered.  My wife sent her steak back.  While waiting for the steak we proceeded to eat our mashed potatoes.  We were shocked to see a bug crawling in the potatoes.  We immediately notified the nearest waitress who initially said it was "chives", until the bug moved and she surprisingly said "Oh my, I apologize" and proceeded to take the potatoes away.  Of course, we were given another side of potatoes, but my wife still did not have her steak.  Our waiter still had not returned to our table.  My wife still did not have her steak.  Our appetite was ruined and we decided we were done and ready to leave.  The Manager comped my wife's steak and the potatoes.  He did apologize as he gave me the bill for my steak and a salad.  Really????
WAITED 1HR AND 1/2 TO GET SERVICE FOR A TABLE OF 8, FOOD WAS COLD, CAKE CAKES WERE BREADED AND VERY SMALL, LOBSTER MAC HAD ONE PIECE OF LOBSTER, SENT EVERYTHING BACK AND GOT REFUNDED
Great food and staff, it was my dad's birthday and they gave us menus with happy birthday printed on it and a huge cake and ice cream dessert that was incredible. The porterhouse was also amazing!

Best steakhouse in Baltimore. Ambience is great and service is unparalleled. Chocolate lava cake is one of the only desserts I will ever order. Appetizers, entrees and sides are superb. Sommelier is very knowledgeable and they have a vast wine list.

christmas eve dinner with family. seated immediately but took 10 min+ for waiter to address table for drinks. no menu's for several minutes after that. no bread brought to table until we asked, which was well after we placed our order. advised waiter 3 times we had a gluten allergy at the table and he acknowledged but low and behold the side dish came out with bread crumbs on it. Also ordered a salad as main course and when delivered to table it was a plate of lettuce! no tomato, no peppers, no onions, no cucumbers..nothing but a plate of lettuce for $13. They did take that of off the bill but what a way to celebrate xmas eve. that experience completely put a cloud over the celebration. Never again. Poor service, poor quality of food selection for allergies. have eaten at several comparable and lesser reputable restaurants which have gone out of their way to accommodate this allergy concern and provided a quality meal. Despite it being xmas eve the restaurant was not busy so that was not the reason for the poor service. many empty tables.

Morton's is truly on another level. This steakhouse deserves it's amazing reputation. Took my girlfriend here for her birthday and they went above and beyond in every possible way. Everything was great! Will be back for sure.
A bit overpriced and overrated. This used to be a great restaurant for an evening with my wife. But the last time I was there I was less than impressed.

Perfect. There isn't much else to say. This steakhouse is so far above par, and so high above expectations, it is hard to fathom. Ambience is excellent, staff & service impeccable, and the food heaven on a plate... The cocktails are precisely made and delicious. Sure, it is extraordinarily expensive, but the value of the experience is beyond compare. From appetizers to mains to sides... Everything was absolutely fabulous. Will definitely return!

Waited more than 30 minutes for salmon and a baked potato. The potato came out cold but the staff quickly returned with a hot one. The server was excellent and the food tasted great but the overall dining experience was below average for the price.
Never disappointed, I LOVE this location.
OMG I’ve been here since 8:30p it is 9:30p still NO FOOD! The slowest service EVER!!!!!! :-(

The service is amazing! No need to talk about the food that’s incredible. The lava cake is something you should try, a star from Morton’s! The manager is great, always attentive. This is a  5 star service!
Great restaurants for a romantic night out. Menu is small. However food is exceptional.

I'm giving it two stars just for the waitress who was awesome. Other than that food and drinks were horrible. Lobster bisque was not bad but only one rubbery piece of lobster. Steak was fatty, shrimps were over cooked, scallops were delicious. Drinks were over priced ($8 Blu Moon bottle) and not anywhere close to being correct when ordering mixed drinks. Overall was a bad dining experience. Will never go back to this place again.

Not a four star restaurant experience. Dining room temperature to low for dining. Server needs to be more attentive to guest. Guest shouldn't have to asked for refills.Four star server training should be revisited. Food was so so, and wasn't hot, not sure if the room temperature caused the food be cold. Priced to high for over all experience. Rating is 2.5 to 3 stars for this visit. Lower the price or up your game. I will skip the next function here.

Food was a terrific lovely environment. I can't say enough good stuff about it.  The atmosphere is very welcoming, and their services were excellent. I would recommend it to families. Great Experience!!

11 May 2019--added to the review below. I now have the gout so I had to avoid red meat. My wife and I split the crab cake entrée. This is Maryland so we know what crab cakes are supposed to taste like. Morton's doesn't even come close to a premium Maryland crab cake. I discussed this with the manager. He said that they were required to use the recipe that comes from corporate headquarters. Apparently, the head chef at the corporate level isn't from Maryland. The crab cake they serve at Morton's is small, dry and uninteresting. Morton's is a premium restaurant. They should either serve excellent crab cakes or take them off the menu. ============ Terrific steak place. A bit pricey, but they let you split meals, and when you do, you still get plenty to eat. I had a French onion soup and a chopped salad. Both were delicious. Then my wife and I split a bone in rib steak,also delicious. If you are near the inner harbor in Baltimore, this is a great place to eat. I am writing this review on a Saturday evening, and the place is pretty full. But I have been here for dinner on weekdays, and it's quieter than on weekend evenings.

First experience with Morton’s. Great food and drinks. Friendly well orchestrated wait staff. I’m rating 3/5 due to lack of hospitality. I attended a reserved business dinner with a group of 15  professionals and alone waited 15 minutes before (while my colleagues ate) before I pointed out no one brought me my entree with the rest of the group. I received no apology, amends, or acknowledgement from management. It was embarrassing to be singled out from the rest of the group when my order wasn’t special, but rather apart of the short and designated menu.
Great service, and food is second to none.
This place was excellent and not crowded at all. I got there early and had 3 awesome appetizers for $28, including the filet mignon trio which was phenomenal.
this place is always my favorite when I go there. the food is always cooked just as I ask. amazing service
Fantastic Food and Lovely Aura. Staff is amazing and I would love to visit this place again.
Food high with small portions some food wasn’t good had to send sum stuff back

Me and my husband went last night for a date night. It was our first time here, and highly recommended by his coworker. The drinks were the best part of the night, the service was so slow and just horrible for the amount of money spent. Our server started off great and had knowledge of the menu and answered our questions. Just after that everything was just slow and just not top notch service that you would expect for Mortons. The food was also just okay, nothing mindblowing about our dinner. My husband doesn't want to come back.

Their happy hour is very misleading. There's a sign outside of the restaurant that says they have "Power Hour" deals, but the sign does not list the hours. I asked the front desk of The Sheraton when those hours were, and they did not know. When I went into the restaurant, I was given a menu with bold green happy hour pricing. I asked my server what time the happy hour started/ended, and she did not know. The non-happy hour prices were listed on the menu, but they're almost indistinguishable from the calories (i.e., in fine print). I ended up paying more than double what I expected. The food was very good, but I wish they would have been more upfront about their promotion.

What can I say about Mortons? It is a high quality steakhouse, that offers a wide variety of sides and entree options. Of course, this place is going to be pricey, but you are paying not only for the taste and quality of food, but also the experience. You are not required to wear a coat jacker, but walking into the restaurant you almost feel like you should. I highly recommend coming to Mortons for that special occasion to celebrate the one you love!
Best steak I ever had. The sides were a little overpriced priced for what they were.

The first time we ate at the Baltimore Morton's was quite impressive. We had a great waiter who has since moved on. The food was just right, salad, etc. etc. We compared it to our Morton's experiences closer to home in Tyson's Corner (now closed) and Reston, VA. Last night was a disappointment. Waiter tried hard but came up short. The salad I ordered wasn't the salad he delivered. He let his own thoughts get ahead of himself and really didn't listen to what I ordered. We couldn't finish our steaks and asked that they and the vegetables be boxed up separately. We were returning to our home and my out of town nephew, whom we were entertaining, was returning to his grandmother's house. Imagine our surprise and disappointment when we both arrived at our destinations to find the food had been switched -- my nephew got my food and I got his. Not returning to Baltimore anytime soon......
Great
If can give the place a 10 stars I would.
Good food however be ready to wait more than 2 hrs to have your food served, this especially if you dine in with more than 5 people.

I went for my birthday and was told that i didn't need reservations.  I get there and was told that i needed reservations but that the bar as open.  I was then seated like 20 min later after my parents said something. The management made it happen and wished me a happy birthday.  The food was amazing. So, if you are planning on going, definitely call ahead and make reservations
Nice stakes
Awesome Staff and Management!
Best steaks we've had in years, and the service could not have been any better. We're going to be back as often as we can.

(Translated by Google) Very good place to eat meat and fish. Very nice atmosphere, excellent attention and first class food. I did not like that the place is a bit noisy, voices boom and it is difficult to speak.  (Original) Muy buen lugar para comer carne y pescado. Muy lindo ambiente excelente atención y comida de primer nivel. No me gustó que el lugar es un poco ruidoso, retumban las voces y es dificil hablar.

Superb service and food! If you are looking for a wonderful dining experience this is it! Oysters on the half shell, salmon with lump crab, the shrimp Alexander, the veal chop were all amazing.  The host, the bartender and servers were tremendous! Go, go, enjoy it!!
Amazing, worth every penny and top notch service imo
Outstanding beef!
Came here for my birthday and had the seasoned ribeye. I'm still thinking about it a month later. They serve their sides in share-style plates and they are big. We didn't come close to finishing ours
best bone-in ribeye

Went during Restaurant week, so they were very busy. Took about 10 minutes after being seated to get even water let alone anyone's attention. Once we did get a server, she was wonderful and helped us select our meal. Food was incredible as usual.

Mortons Baltimore is nothing short of Phenomenal!!! Sam and Patrick made our anniversary perfect!!! Sam is a true class act!!!! Patrick made the sangria tasting personal and intriguing. Our server Moose was incredible and as always Chef Jackson was on point!!!! 10 stars for service. Angela and I love you guys!!!!
Food was good but I expected more.

Amazing meal from start to finish.  Our server was amazing alrhalth I do not remember her name.  The bacon wrapped scallops the best I've ever had.  Rack of lamb was cooked perfect. Crab cakes are outstanding.  Topped off with a yummy pineapple drink and chocolate mouse . The service was top of the line. The valet parking was the only downfall.
Great staff, excellent food
Such a great ambience. Food was great. Bartender super friendly and professional. Will be back.
Great steaks, awesome service. Definitely worthy of a return visit.
Food was over priced and not that good. Ruth Chris is way better. Service was great though.
This place is the best. Sure it's pricey but you get your  money's worth. The food and the service are excellent.
One of the best restaurants I've been too. Reminded me of a nice upscale Vegas restaurant.
nice food

The food was mediocre and the wait for food was close to an hour. The rack of lamb was supposed to be medium rare but it was still raw in some parts and over cooked at the edges. The mint chutney also tasted like tooth paste.
Look it's a chain but it's consist and the steaks are great.

My Husband and I really had an amazing date night here! Our Waiter was Mustafa and he was extremely knowledgeable about the wine and cocktails menu. As well as the dinner and desserts menu. I tried the lemon drop & my Husband chose a seasonal cocktail, the St. Tropez. Let me just say, Morton's bartenders are not skimpy with the alcohol. Our drinks were superb! 🤗🙌🏽💪🏽👍🏽👌🏽 For dinner, we both went with a seasonal menu item which was the 14oz bone in filet (Oscar style: lump crab meat in bearnaise sauce atop) and my God it was delicious! I mean melt in your mouth tender. We chose the creamed corn and sour cream mashed potatoes for our sharable sides. We couldn't believe how well our steaks were seasoned. And have I mentioned tender yet?! LOL. I finished off with bread pudding for dessert which I had to take the majority of it home. (Being greedy ordering it in the 1st place if I'm honest) Do yourself a favor and treat yourself to an outstanding dining experience at Morton's Baltimore, you will not be disappointed. We will certainly be back, well worth the money! 😍🤗

Stayed at the Sheraton that it’s connected to and went there for happy hour food and drinks. Had a wonderful time before heading out for the night with friends. Left my phone there and unfortunately wasn’t able to find it even though the gps tracker located it to be in the building. Kept tracking the location and realized it started to move when they closed and the employees left. Continued to track the phone overnight and provided the information to the management. The gm (Sam) n the management were very helpful in retrieving the phone back from the now former employee. It was unfortunate that an incident like this happened but I was very happy that the management was helpful in looking into details (checking with corporate to check addresses of employees to see if it matched the pinpointed address I provided with the phone tracker and much more) when they could’ve easily try to protect themselves and their employees and simply said sorry about my phone with a smile. Two thumbs up!
Awesome experience! The food was great and the staff are very accommodating and friendly. Will com back again soon.
I don't know if I went there too late at night, but the steak was just ok (filet mignon). Not really anything spectacular.  For the prices they charge, I prob. would not go again.

Excellent staff. Our waiter was named Tom and he was super patient and helpful as it was my first time there. My friend and I LOVED the food. Pricey but most definitely worth it. We are both going back for sure. I recommend the Lobster macaroni and cheese. They aren't like most restaurants that say there is crab or lobster in food items and you barely see any in there. It was plentiful and delicious.
Here for restaurant week.  Value was amazing.  Service was impeccable.

Sadly, because their were a few celebrities here during our visit, we were ignored. Our food, on the other hand, was cooked to perfection. Hard to give a better review when the wait staff were only concerned with taIking care of certain people. For the price we paid and the gratuity that was added to our bill, we should have had the same attention as the other party 😡

I understand this is a place known for steak, but I went went several colleagues and ordered the Salmon.  Probably the worst fish I've ever tasted in my life. It was white (Salmon should be pink) and had zero flavor. As a seafood fanatic, this was NOT a piece of fresh fish. Definetly find elsewhere if you're looking for good seafood.

Anniversary evening out started off customer service oriented, but then, DISAPPOINTING! Ordered a porter house, medium well/ blackened (not uncommon in steak houses). What arrived was a room temperature cut on a hot plate that was bland and grisly on the outside. Had to return it. What returned, while seasoned (saw the cook spoon on some drippings) was no better than what I've had at a Ruby Tuesdays or a TGI's. I've eaten at the Ruth's Chris , The Prime Rib, Fogo's, and the Brass Elephant (all 4 or more stars In my opinion ) on more than one occasion, and have never been dissatisfied. Decided to go different this time around. Lesson learned! Almost forgot. Initially offered to comp ours desserts (plural) due to the mishap, but reconsidered when it came time to order dessert advising they'd only comp for one person's dessert in a party of two? Expected more from what's considered to be a high end Steak House.

Just an update after 10 days. Mortons made no attempts to reach out to me via phone, email, or this review...  Service started out great. Server was very friendly and energetic. Scallops were ok. Salads good. Her filet and lobster were perfect. My ribeye was medium-well when it should have been medium-rare. Sent back. Next one comes out. I'm asked to "cut into" it. It's Pittsburgh style (burnt outside, raw/purple inside). Sent back again. 3rd time comes out. Same steak as the second one ($60 steak). Now it's all messed up. Well-done here, medium there, medium-rare in 1 spot.  Sent back. 4th time. Comes out medium-rare. Excellent finally. Up to this point, not the server's fault. Desert takes another 15 mins to come out after dinner is done. Then after desert, takes another 20+ minutes to pay and leave..... Happy Valentine's Day...
The steak is the best
Pricey. Lobster Mac n Cheese.....amazing !!!

While on our way to the restaurant (we had a reservation) I was looking up the reviews.. saw one that said they had reservations received a call before they got to the restaurant saying the restaurant wouldn't be opening tonight so they needed to go elsewhere. I didn't think anything of this until we parked and I looked at my moms phone to see a voicemail from Mortons; they wouldn't be opening the restaurant tonight... Sounds like they do this fairly regulary.. we went to Ruth's Chris instead and the service and food were phenomenal. Don't take the chance that Mortons will decide not to open the night of your special occasion!
(Translated by Google) Excellent steak  (Original) Excelente steak
Great Meal
Great food!
Delicious food. Great service.  Just what's to be expected from a restaurant of this price point.
One of the bests
My favorite place to eat in Baltimore!

Service is good. Food came out slow. The bread delicious. Morton salad lacks flavor. Ceasar salad delicious. Seven us at the table all but one steak was delicious. Seventh steak really tough. Chocolate mouse tastes like coffe an key lime pie not much taste. Dissapointing for price.
I sooooooo love this place
Excellent service. Excellent food.
Service is not good and the food is average. Not worth the money. I have been here twice and in was dissappointed both times. They also sear the steaks to hard and it has an off putting burnt taste.
Excellent Everytime
used to be my favorite high end restaurant, then Landry's took over and everything went down hill.  not worth the money

Reservations made for a special occasion and the restaurant calls and leaves a voicemail stating they 'decided' not to open on the day of our reservation. No reason, no alternative offer, nothing. Find a place you can count on when you make plans. This place isn't it.

You pay more for the "prestige" of this place than the food. Classic upscale restaurant style: tiny food portions for extremely high prices designed more to look good on the plate than actually be good tasting. Which would be okay, if they actually offered upscale service to match that style. But that is sadly not the case.
Excellent steaks and dinner...
Good steak Tacos. Great service

I had a 5pm reservation on 2/6/2016, at the Morton’s in downtown Baltimore and was very disappointed with my Chicago Style Ribeye.   My steak was dry and didn’t have any seasoning.  All chefs should know to put some salt and pepper on food.  I have been to this location twice before and had delicious steaks that were juicy, tender and seasoned.  General Manager Christopher Deen, who was on call that night,came to my table to give me his card and expressed that the next time that I come he will personally pick out my steak.  I’m perfectly capable of choosing a steak.  That wasn’t the problem.  The problem was the dryness and no seasoning on the steak.  I also emailed Mr. Deen on 2/8/2016, and never received a response.  All I can say is that I will not be returning to this location again.

A very disappointing experience. The steaks were way below acceptable standards. The filet was to be cooked med well. Came out blood red. Sent back, it then came out over cooked and burnt on one side. The bone in filet was raw at the bone. It was disgusting. Will not be back & will not recommend.
Consistently excellent service.

We had a horrible experience at the Baltimore Morton's this past weekend (Friday, May 15, 2015). We had a party of 10, so you can guess what was spent; $$$. While the food was what you would expect for the money, the service was not, and a major detraction. To me, at any restaurant, service is as important as the meal. The waiter seemed to be somewhere else all the time; and we felt like we were being "fit into" his mission. Moreover and what made the experience unpleasant to all at the table: He pushed to up-sell us ON EVERY ITEM. We had to fight him to just order what we wanted. As one example, he was not successful on getting enough side dishes when he first went around and proceeded to lecture us that we needed to order 5 sides for the party. When he didn't get the answer he wanted at one end of the table, he worked the other end. This could be a nice place; their management practice and staff actions made a celebration into an unpleasant event.
I ordered the porterhouse, it was good and big However for less than 1/2 the price I could get about the same at longhorn stake house

Let's start with the good...  The valet was very nice and cordial.  Thanked me for his tip.  Guys serving water and all that were also very attentive.  Waiter could not have been less attentive.  Steaks (both of us had bone-in ribeyes) came out cooked poorly.  One was to be medium, the other medium rare.  We could hardly tell the difference between the two and both were close to medium well.  It took a loooong time and we both decided not to send steaks back. Sides were ok but not great (had mac and cheese and Brussels sprouts as well).  At this price level, mediocre will not cut it.  I was there for 1.5 hours and the waiter never refilled my original iced tea.  I had a cocktail that I finished within 15 minutes.  No offer for another.  Same for my guest's beer.  In fact, the waiter came back once after the actual meal hit the table... to bring the check.  Very disappointing experience.  Last time I ate at Morton's was the location in downtown Houston, TX.  Was quite different from this.  I will not be returning to Morton's in Baltimore.  I have been to Sullivan's as well as Capitol Grille (many visits).  I recommend either of those over Morton's.  In fact, I rate Capitol Grille very highly.  Just wanted to try Morton's here.  Now I have done it.  Let my experience serve as a warning to you.  If you are looking for a high-end steakhouse experience in Baltimore, you have many, many better options.

I was in town for a seminar and decided to try this place.  Its a nice atmosphere and the staff are friendly.  It was fairly busy and the staffing seemed to be somewhat thin as evidenced by the often frantic pace of the staff.  I had a bottle of a German hefeweizen beer, lobster bisque and a combination platter which included a 6 oz filet mignon (medium), three large grilled shrimp and 2 scallops wrapped in bacon.  This was accompanied by three large stalks of asparagus.  I also had a loaf of the onion, garlic, and poppy seed encrusted bread.  The lobster bisque had a forward taste (beef consomme) that hid the lobster flavor but still acceptable.  The shrimp and scallops were average; not over cooked and chewy but not delicate texture either.  I like asparagus but the highlighter thick stalks were a little to woody for me.  Had one bite and left the rest.  This brings me to the filet.  It was cooked slightly past medium with a little charring on the edges.  The flavor and texture is what would expect from filet mignon.  All in all it was a very average meal at a way above average price.  Additionally, management has chosen to sacrafice the ability of its staff to provide the typical attentative service expected in this price range by not scheduling enough staff.  This is in no way a criticism of the staff.  I suggest you save your money and eat at an Outback Steahouse.  Similar quality food and same frantic waiting staff.  I will be going to a local steakhouse house (Johnny's) this weekend to be wow'ed by a steak and make my Morton's Steakhouse experience a forgotten memory.

We arrived late in the evening and decided to try. I'm not a huge steak lover, but I had short prime ribs, potatoes, and shrimp. That meat was so tender and the juices that came out of it I could have slapped my mamma..it was good. My husband hand the pork lion and baked potatoes. He could not finished his plate. The waiters were so friendly-atmosphere was dark but just right -the drinks were great! Will be back again
steaks practically melt in your mouth. great sides and drinks.

We love this restaurant.  I'm a little disturbed by some other reviews that focus so much on price.  If price is your concern, you probably shouldn't be going to Morton's or any of its peers for dinner.  If you fill up on bread and order an entree' with water only, you'll still pay $100 for two.  Add wine, sides, and the must-have desserts and you may get close to $200.  The atmosphere is relaxed elegant - or casual elegant.  One of the reasons we love it here is that t-shirt and shorts on a hot summer day are as common as suits and ties for business meetings.  Morton's is unpretentious in its welcome of guests.  The service, in keeping with the atmosphere, is professional and friendly, and is customer-first-focused.  If there's the slightest problem, one can alert a manager and be sure it will be handled in short order.  That being said, I was also disturbed about some other user comments about service.  If you aren't pleased and don't address it with the manager immediately, shame on you.  This is not Outback, and the experience shouldn't be judged on folksy servers or meals-in-an-hour.  It's a dining experience.  Plan on two hours and enjoy.  Look for their sometimes-unpublished specials:  Steak and Seafood for $99 - includes two salads, two seafood apps, two steaks, two sides and two desserts.  A great meal for two for a very reasonable price for a very filling meal.  The steak is a filet, but some seafood substitutions and steak upgrades are available.  They have some other off-the-menu deals as well.  We our frequent steakhouse diners.  In  Baltimore, we have found this to be the best overall combination of atmosphere, service, food, and price.  Server Brent is always top-notch, too.
very upscale and pricey but very very good  king of prussia, pa
we came very late in the evening,   baby in tow.  service was as if the   baby wasn't even there!  fantastic!    food was excellent, as always.
traditional

for steak, my personal preference is to head downtown to smith & wollensky, but the lava dessert at morton's is to die for. just make sure you order it at the beginning of your meal - it takes 45 min to prepare. if you're in gtown and you're looking for a good steak, you really can't beat morton's
